comments.comment: Ah, I think this has to do with the fact that I'm releasing the GIL in the PyCaffe version on this branch (to allow multithreaded data-prefetch in python while the GPU is doing forward/backward computations). I don't think the python-layer likes that. Let me see what I can do about it.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/naibaf7>@naibaf7</denchmark-link> Ah, yes, I saw that. Thanks for looking at that. Do we need a special path that doesn't release the GIL when Python layers are present?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ngaloppo>@ngaloppo</denchmark-link>
I think a neat solution would be instead to acquire and release the GIL again in the python layer. I'm currently researching if that is possible or not. If not, then yes, a second path without releasing the GIL is required. I did not use the python layer before so this bug went through unnoticed so far.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ngaloppo>@ngaloppo</denchmark-link>
Ok should be fixed, does not Segfault anymore.
